status: CRITICAL — Strategic anchor for all NYQST implementation work
schemas_defined: Platform Primitive to Module Reuse Matrix (10x5 grid)
Three-layer architecture: Layer 1 (10 primitives), Layer 2 (5 domain modules), Layer 3 (enterprise shell)
bl_items_referenced: All 22 BL items mapped to 10 platform primitives
key_signals: Core insight: Superagent parity builds PLATFORM PRIMITIVES; research module is TEST HARNESS proving they work; domain modules (Lease CDs, Debt MVP, PropSygnal, RegSygnal) run ON this platform

10 Layer 1 primitives: Agentic Runtime, GENUI, MCP Tools, Document Management, Provenance & Citation, Context Engineering, LLM Integration, Reactive State & Streaming, Agent Management, Billing & Metering
Layer 2: Research (v1), Lease CDs (wedge), Debt MVP (Q2 2026), PropSygnal, RegSygnal
Layer 3: SSO/OIDC/SAML, RBAC/ABAC, multi-tenant isolation, data residency, audit trails, enterprise billing
Success criterion: 'Can a NEW domain module use this primitive WITHOUT modifying platform code?'

schemas_defined: Three-layer analysis methodology: Product / Agents / Quality
key_signals: OBJ-1: Understand Superagent system completely → SYSTEM-ARCHITECTURE.md
OBJ-2: Understand agentic system completely → AGENTIC-SYSTEM.md
OBJ-3: Infer methods for top-class results → QUALITY-METHODS.md
OBJ-4: Continuous goal focus — deliver at least as good, living backlog
Agent dispatch: haiku (summarize, catalog), sonnet (investigate, implement), opus (review, validate, dispatch complex work)
Methodology: three-layer decomposition (product → agents → quality)

key_decisions: 10 discipline-based slices for function-level team coordination
schemas_defined: Slice structure (10 slices with directory, discipline, mandate)
BL item assignments by slice (22 items distributed across 8 primary slices)
key_signals: 10 slices: Backend, Agentic, Context Management, Orchestration & Planning, Core Services, Infrastructure, Testing, Product/UX/Frontend, Research, Standards
Frontend merged into Product/UX (owns whole user journey, not separate track)
Context Management separate from Agentic (token budget/memory vs graph execution)
Research and Standards are first-class slices (not support functions)
Concession model: slices decide independently within domain; schema/API/SSE/security changes require Standards review

Implementation structure: 3 parallel agents writing CLAUDE.md in Phase 1 (Backend/Agentic/Context, then Orchestration/Core/Infrastructure, then Testing/Product/Research), then 1 agent for Standards + root index
